studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Clarified the descriptive and optional nature of subsequent overall survival (OS) analyses after statistical significance is reached.
Added Severe Cutaneous Adverse Reactions (SCARs) as a risk and safety precaution for atezolizumab.
Updated management guidelines for Grade 3 dermatologic events and added guidelines for SJS/TEN.
Introduction of COVID-19 risk considerations, exclusion criteria, and management guidelines.
Broadened exclusion criteria for severe infections to include investigator discretion on patient safety.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Align with updates in the Atezolizumab Investigatorâ€™s Brochure, Version 17.
Address risks and operational considerations related to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Improve clarity and consistency across the protocol document.

studyChanges.summary: New section added to describe COVID-19-related risks.

studyChanges.beforeText: Severe infection within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia
studyChanges.afterText: Severe infection within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment... updated to include any active infection that, the opinion of the investigator, could impact patient safety
studyChanges.summary: Expanded exclusion criteria for infections based on investigator opinion.
Added SCARs as a specific risk associated with atezolizumab.

studyChanges.afterText: Management Guidelines for Hepatic Events for Patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma
studyChanges.summary: Updated hepatic event management to align with Investigator's Brochure v17.

studyChanges.afterText: Descriptive and optional nature of subsequent OS analyses once statistical significance is reached
studyChanges.summary: Clarified the status of OS analyses post-statistical significance.
